name: Congenital Jejunal Atresia with Volvulus
chief_complaint: My baby hasn't passed stool in 2 days and keeps vomiting green fluid
physical_findings: palpable abdominal mass in right upper quadrant
prognosis: Guarded - depends on timing of intervention and presence of complications like necrotizing enterocolitis or short bowel syndrome
description: A rare congenital intestinal obstruction caused by complete discontinuity of the jejunum, often associated with malrotation and volvulus. The condition results from in-utero vascular accidents leading to ischemic necrosis of a segment of bowel. Requires urgent surgical intervention to prevent life-threatening complications.
risk_factors: history of intestinal atresia in siblings
